definition: theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: He is a member of Shanghai Dramatists Association.
sentences.chinese: 現爲上海戲劇家協會會員。

sentences.english: Tian Han is known as a dramatist in literature history.
sentences.chinese: 文學史上的田漢以戲劇家聞名。

sentences.english: With the inborn bold and unconstrained temperament, the Ming dramatist Shen Zizheng was known for his roving experience like a brave.
sentences.chinese: 明代戲劇家沈自徵其性格和氣質頗具遊俠色彩。

sentences.english: The dramatist Guan Hanqing had the lofty status in the history of Chinese literature in the Han dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 元代戲劇家關漢卿在中國文學史上有着崇高的地位。

pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 Zuo4 jia1 Xie2 hui4

definition: Communication University of China (CUC), the highest institute of radio, film and television education in China
pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 Chuan2 mei2 Da4 xue2
